Fortis Healthcare Ltd is looking for Associate Consultant Paediatrics to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey      The Associate Consultant in Pediatrics is a medical professional responsible for providing specialized care to pediatric patients      This role involves clinical practice, collaboration with healthcare teams, teaching, and participation in departmental activities to ensure the highest standard of pediatric care        Key Responsibilities:        Clinical Practice:Provide comprehensive medical care to pediatric patients, including diagnosis, treatment, and follow-up      Conduct routine check-ups, immunizations, and screenings      Manage acute and chronic pediatric conditions      Patient Care:Oversee the admission, care, and discharge of pediatric patients      Collaborate with nursing staff and allied health professionals to optimize patient outcomes      Communicate effectively with patients and their families, ensuring a compassionate and supportive environment      Teaching and Training:Supervise and mentor junior medical staff, residents, and medical students      Participate in educational programs and initiatives within the pediatrics department      Provide clinical instruction and guidance to medical trainees      Collaboration:Work closely with multidisciplinary teams, including nurses, nutritionists, social workers, and therapists      Collaborate with other medical specialties for comprehensive patient care      Engage in regular case discussions and team meetings      Quality Improvement:Participate in quality assurance activities to enhance patient safety and care standards      Contribute to the development and implementation of clinical protocols and guidelines      Assist in the review of departmental policies to ensure compliance with best practices and regulatory standards      Research and Innovation:Participate in pediatric research projects and clinical trials      Stay updated on advancements in pediatric medicine      Implement evidence-based practices in patient care

column2: Fortis Healthcare Ltd is looking for Associate Consultant - Paediatric Hemato-Oncology & BMT to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey         Patient Evaluation and Diagnosis    : Associate Consultants in Pediatric Hemato-Oncology & BMT evaluate pediatric patients with suspected or confirmed hematological disorders or cancers. They conduct thorough medical histories, physical examinations, and diagnostic tests to establish accurate diagnoses and develop appropriate treatment plans.                Treatment Planning and Decision-making    : They participate in developing individualized treatment plans for pediatric patients based on their specific diagnosis, disease stage, and overall health. Treatment options may include chemotherapy, radiation therapy, immunotherapy, targeted therapy, and hematopoietic stem cell transplantation (bone marrow transplant).                Bone Marrow Transplantation (BMT)    : Associate Consultants oversee the bone marrow transplant process for pediatric patients with conditions such as leukemia, aplastic anemia, and genetic disorders. This involves coordinating donor selection, pre-transplant conditioning regimens, transplantation procedures, and post-transplant care and monitoring.                Chemotherapy and Radiation Therapy    : They manage chemotherapy and radiation therapy treatments for pediatric patients with hematological malignancies. This includes prescribing chemotherapy regimens, monitoring treatment responses, and managing treatment-related side effects to ensure the best possible outcomes.                Pain and Symptom Management    : Associate Consultants provide comprehensive pain and symptom management for pediatric patients undergoing cancer treatment. They address pain, nausea, fatigue, and other treatment-related side effects to improve patients' quality of life during and after treatment.                Supportive Care and Psychosocial Support    : They coordinate supportive care services and psychosocial support for pediatric patients and their families throughout the treatment process. This includes providing emotional support, counseling services, and resources to help families cope with the challenges of childhood cancer.                Clinical Research and Trials      : Many Associate Consultants participate in clinical research studies and trials aimed at advancing the understanding and treatment of pediatric hematological disorders and cancers. They contribute to research protocols, enroll patients in clinical trials, and collaborate with multidisciplinary teams to improve treatment outcomes.

Qualification -MBBS, MD/DNB-Pediatrics (plus NNF preferred) Location - PAN India Experience- 0 to 5 Yrs    If interested for the above role please share your resume to richa.j@motherhoodindia.com or call / wats app resume on 9667018894 Regards Richa Jain

Job Description     Key Responsibilities Responsible to start treatment as soon as patient arrives in Emergency/Wards and keep follow up of day to day treatment of patients by the consultants. To provide medical treatment of critically ill patient in a shift duty coverage.  To be present at all relevant clinical rounds. To complete all the medical records of the patients. To maintain log book on daily basis and get it signed by consultants. To follow departmental guidelines relating to routine clinical duties in the ICU / Wards. To perform routine and emergency clinical procedures as indicated. To provide acute resuscitation for trauma and other emergencies when requested from Emergency and other hospital wards. To examine the patients, order investigations and prescribe treatment if necessary, and to update patient records. On call duty to be performed as per duty schedule and are expected to leave the hospital only after giving proper written handover to the doctor coming in next shift. Counselling and communication both Verbal & Written with patients to ensure patient satisfaction.

column2: The IRB Consultant is crucial in providing expertise and guidance to researchers and institutions to ensure compliance with ethical standards and regulatory requirements in human subjects research        The consultant is responsible for offering support throughout the research process, from protocol development to ongoing monitoring and compliance                   ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:                  Collaborate with researchers to review and refine research protocols to meet ethical standards and regulatory obligations.              Assess risk-benefit analyses and ensure the protection of human subjects.              Assist in the preparation of informed consent forms and other relevant documentation.              Provide expertise during IRB meetings, addressing ethical considerations and regulatory compliance.              Collaborate with IRB members to address questions or concerns related to research proposals.              Assist in developing and updating institutional policies related to human subjects research.                    EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:                  Advanced degree in a relevant field (e.g., bioethics, public health, social sciences).              Strong communication and interpersonal skills.              Detail-oriented with the ability to analyze complex research protocols.                    PREFERRED SKILLS:                  Experience in reviewing IRB applications and clinical research protocols.              Previous experience serving on or working with an IRB is highly desirable.              Knowledge of US Federal IRB regulations, policies, and procedures regarding human subjects research protection programs and approval to conduct research.              Excellent writing skills, including generating clear, precise, detailed study reviews.
column11: Interpersonal skills, Clinical trials, IRB, Regulatory compliance, Clinical research, Oncology, Life sciences, Research, Monitoring, Public health

column2: DOCTORS DOOR  is looking for NEONATOLOGIST  to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey    Care of Premature and High-Risk Newborns: Neonatologists specialize in the care of newborns who are premature (born before 37 weeks of gestation) or those who have other medical conditions that require specialized care      NICU Care: They manage newborns in the NICU, which is equipped with advanced medical equipment and technology to provide intensive care for critically ill infants      Respiratory Support: Neonatologists are skilled in managing respiratory distress in premature infants, including the use of mechanical ventilation and other respiratory support measures      Nutritional Support: They ensure that newborns receive the appropriate nutrition and fluids, especially in cases where infants are unable to breastfeed or bottle-feed      Infection Control: Neonatologists are vigilant in preventing and treating infections in the NICU, which can be particularly dangerous for vulnerable newborns      Neonatal Surgery: In some cases, surgical intervention may be necessary for conditions like congenital anomalies      Neonatologists work closely with neonatal surgeons and other specialists when surgical procedures are required      Monitoring and Assessment: Neonatologists closely monitor vital signs, growth, and development, and they use diagnostic tests to assess and diagnose medical conditions      Parent and Family Support: They provide emotional and educational support to parents and families, helping them understand their infant's condition and care plan      Preventive Care: Neonatologists promote preventive measures such as immunizations and screenings to protect newborns from common neonatal illnesses
